snippet: Nuns in the Sisters of the Most Holy and Immaculate Heart of the Blessed Virgin Mary said in court papers that they were being bullied and betrayed by the Archdiocese of Los Angeles into supporting a sale to Katy Perry.
abstract: Two nuns at Sisters of the Most Holy and Immaculate Heart of the Blessed Virgin Mary file legal objection against Archdiocese of Los Angeles, intensifying ongoing dispute over sale of convent and raising questions of authority of civil and canon law; claim that sale of property to pop singer Katy Perry would force them to violate their vows to Catholic Church.
lead_paragraph: Nuns in the Sisters of the Most Holy and Immaculate Heart of the Blessed Virgin Mary said in court papers that they were being bullied and betrayed by the Archdiocese of Los Angeles into supporting a sale to Katy Perry.

headline.main: Nuns Intensify Fight Over Sale of Convent to Katy Perry
headline.print_headline: Filings by Nuns Intensify Fight Over Sale of Their Convent to Pop Singer
